fields.Description/Abstract:
Happy People (previously titled Black Happy) is an original feature-length screenplay. In September 2016, the script was placed under contract with Anonymous Content, an L.A.-based production and management company. David Kanter is the associated producer, with actor Jason Segel also heavily involved in development. As part of the contract, I was hired to do a revision for Anonymous Content.

Developing the work with David Kanter and Jason Segel, I completed the revision of Happy People in early 2017, which was then accepted by Anonymous Content. The project subsequently went out to directors, and Jeff Baena attached himself to the project. 

In 2018, creative collaboration between Jeff Baena, Jason Segel, and myself stalled. Anonymous Content is allowing the option to expire and the project will reenter studio packaging through Jon Levin of Fourward. Alas, thus is screenwriting. 

Small footnote: the Faculty 180 status categories are woefully inadequate for the discipline of screenwriting. I"m marking the project as "Discontinued," though that's hardly the case. Screenplays often go through many rounds of contractual development and packaging like this one.
